result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joanna M. Herrick
Current: E19730 Cty  Rd GG, Augusta, WI 54722 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2022)
Prior: E19730 Cty Rd GG, Augusta, WI 54722 United States

9:44 AM cases 22CM548, 22CM435, 21CT237, 22CT151, 21CT253, 21CT291, 22CT236, 21TR5821, 21TR5822, 22TR4463 called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joanna M. Herrick in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad. Attorney Hillestad states there is an offer which requires the defendant to obtain a valid driver's license which the defendant handed to him. Requests to take it to DA's office and recall case later. Off record at 9:45 AM

10:12 AM case recalled. Same appearances. Agreement is to amend 21CT237 Count 1: Operating While Revoked to County Ordinance No Driver's License on Person and amend 22CT151 Count 1: Operating While Revoked to County Ordinance No Driver's License on Person, all other cases and charges to be dismissed and read in.

21CT237: Defendant pleads No Contest to amended charge County Ordinance No Driver's License on Person. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
22CT151: Defendant pleads No Contest to amended charge County Ordinance No Driver's License on Person. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

In 21CT237 and 22CT151 Court orders: costs. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including 22CM548, 22CM435, 21CT253, 21CT291, 22CT236 in their entirety and 21TR5821, 21TR5822, 22TR4463.

9:51 AM Cases called: 22CT236, 22CT151,22CM548, 22CM435, 21CT291, 21CT253 & 21CT237. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joanna M. Herrick in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Joanna M. Herrick. Defendant should have her driver's license reinstated within a month. Defense requests new date.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:11 AM Cases called: 21CT237, 21CT253, 21CT291, 22CM435, 22CM548, 22CT151 & 22CT236. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joanna M. Herrick in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Joanna M. Herrick.

22CM548 & 22CT236: Waives reading of the complaints. Bond is set. Defendant 

All cases: Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/27/22 at 1:30pm
Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
